catalysts.thesis: Reported 'exceptional' Q1 2026 earnings with 52% YoY EBITDA growth and raised guidance, yet the stock has only reacted modestly (+2.4%), presenting a classic PEAD opportunity as analysts re-rate the infrastructure tailwinds.
catalysts.catalyst_details: Q1 Fiscal 2026 Earnings Beat (Jan 8, 2026): EPS $1.58 vs $1.55 est; Revenue $2.03B. Core EBITDA margin expanded to 14.9%.
catalysts.absorption_status: Price is up ~2% pre-market/early trade; low initial volatility suggests institutional accumulation phase has not yet peaked.
catalysts.prediction_market: High confidence in continued drift due to infrastructure spend.
catalysts.recency_proof: Jan 8, 2026 PR Newswire: CMC Reports First Quarter Fiscal 2026 Results.
catalysts.risk: Cyclical downturn in steel pricing or construction slowdown.
catalysts.mispricing_evidence: Trading at ~10.6x Forward P/E vs Industry avg of ~14x despite 50%+ EBITDA growth rate.
